00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlVolumeNode - MRML node for representing a volume (image stack).
00015 // .SECTION Description
00016 // Volume nodes describe data sets that can be thought of as stacks of 2D 
00017 // images that form a 3D volume.  Volume nodes describe where the images 
00018 // are stored on disk, how to render the data (window and level), and how 
00019 // to read the files.  This information is extracted from the image 
00020 // headers (if they exist) at the time the MRML file is generated.  
00021 // Consequently, MRML files isolate MRML browsers from understanding how 
00022 // to read the myriad of file formats for medical data. 
00023 
00024 #ifndef __vtkMrmlVolumeNode_h
00025 #define __vtkMrmlVolumeNode_h
00026 
00027 //#include <iostream.h>
00028 //#include <fstream.h>
00029 #include "vtkMrmlNode.h"
00030 #include "vtkMatrix4x4.h"
00031 #include "vtkTransform.h"
00032 #include "vtkSlicer.h"
00033 #include "vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode.h"
00034 
00035 #ifndef vtkFloatingPointType
00036 #define vtkFloatingPointType float
00037 #endif

00039 // found this the hard way: this had been a 'magic number' that allowed
00040 // the user to run off the end of the array with no error checking -- tsk tsk.
00041 #define DICOM_FILE_LIMIT 10000

00051   // these control the center of the voxel in ijk space - default is 0.5, center
00052   // of the voxel while 0.0 would be upper corner

00068 
00069   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00070   // How to Read/Write volume data contained by this node.
00071   // This sub-node should contain information specific to each
00072   // type of volume that needs to be read in.  This can be used
00073   // to clean up the special cases in this file which handle
00074   // volumes of various types, such as dicom, header, etc.  In
00075   // future these things can be moved to the sub-node specific for that
00076   // type of volume.  The sub-nodes here that describe specific volume
00077   // types each correspond to an implementation of the reader/writer,
00078   // which can be found in a vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite subclass.
00079   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00080   vtkSetObjectMacro(ReadWriteNode, vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode);
00081   vtkGetObjectMacro(ReadWriteNode, vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode);
00082

00092   // Description:
00093   // The pattern for naming the files expressed in C language syntax. 
00094   // For example, a file named skin.001 has a patter of %s.%03d, and a file
00095   // named skin.1 has a pattern of %s.%d
00096   vtkSetStringMacro(FilePattern);
00097   vtkGetStringMacro(FilePattern);
00098

00100   // Prefix of the image files. For example, the prefix of /d/skin.001 is /d/skin

00235 
00236   // Description:
00237   // MR Diffusion Tensor Images may be saved on disk with 
00238   // the frequency encode direction non-standard.  For supine
00239   // scans in the slicer, set this to 1 for in-plane 
00240   // rotation/axis swaps which will put the images into standard
00241   // ax/sag/cor orientations.  This is currently a boolean variable
00242   // here and not written to MRML; its effects are seen in the 
00243   // RasToIjk matrix.  In future this boolean, or a better description
00244   // of the transformation, may be put into the MRML format.
00245   vtkGetMacro(FrequencyPhaseSwap, int);
00246   vtkSetMacro(FrequencyPhaseSwap, int);
00247

00258   // Description:
00259   // The order of slices in the volume. One of: LR (left-to-right), 
00260   // RL, AP, PA, IS, SI. This information is encoded in the rasToIjkMatrix.
00261   // This matrix can be computed either from corner points, or just he
00262   // scanOrder.
00263   void ComputeRasToIjkFromScanOrder(char *order);
00264   static char* ComputeScanOrderFromRasToIjk(vtkMatrix4x4 *RasToIjk);

00271   // Description:
00272   // Compute the rasToIjkMatrix from the corner points of the volume.
00273 
00274   int ComputeRasToIjkFromCorners(vtkFloatingPointType *fc, vtkFloatingPointType *ftl, vtkFloatingPointType *ftr, 
00275     vtkFloatingPointType *fbr, vtkFloatingPointType *lc, vtkFloatingPointType *ltl, vtkFloatingPointType zoffset);
00276 
00277   int ComputeRasToIjkFromCorners(vtkFloatingPointType *fc, vtkFloatingPointType *ftl, vtkFloatingPointType *ftr, 
00278                                  vtkFloatingPointType *fbr, vtkFloatingPointType *lc, vtkFloatingPointType *ltl)
00279   {
00280     return ComputeRasToIjkFromCorners( fc,  ftl,  ftr, fbr,  lc,  ltl, 0.5);
00281   };
00282 
00283   int ComputeRasToIjkFromCorners(
00284     vtkFloatingPointType fcR,  vtkFloatingPointType fcA,  vtkFloatingPointType fcS,
00285     vtkFloatingPointType ftlR, vtkFloatingPointType ftlA, vtkFloatingPointType ftlS, 
00286     vtkFloatingPointType ftrR, vtkFloatingPointType ftrA, vtkFloatingPointType ftrS, 
00287     vtkFloatingPointType fbrR, vtkFloatingPointType fbrA, vtkFloatingPointType fbrS, 
00288     vtkFloatingPointType lcR,  vtkFloatingPointType lcA,  vtkFloatingPointType lcS, 
00289     vtkFloatingPointType ltlR, vtkFloatingPointType ltlA, vtkFloatingPointType ltlS) {
00290     vtkFloatingPointType fc[3], ftl[3], ftr[3], fbr[3], lc[3], ltl[3];
00291     fc[0]=fcR; fc[1]=fcA; fc[2]=fcS;
00292     ftl[0]=ftlR; ftl[1]=ftlA; ftl[2]=ftlS;
00293     ftr[0]=ftrR; ftr[1]=ftrA; ftr[2]=ftrS;
00294     fbr[0]=fbrR; fbr[1]=fbrA; fbr[2]=fbrS;
00295     lc[0]=lcR; lc[1]=lcA; lc[2]=lcS;
00296     ltl[0]=ltlR; ltl[1]=ltlA; ltl[2]=ltlS;
00297     return(this->ComputeRasToIjkFromCorners(fc, ftl, ftr, fbr, lc, ltl));};
00298 
00299 int ComputeRasToIjkFromCorners(
00300     vtkFloatingPointType fcR,  vtkFloatingPointType fcA,  vtkFloatingPointType fcS,
00301     vtkFloatingPointType ftlR, vtkFloatingPointType ftlA, vtkFloatingPointType ftlS, 
00302     vtkFloatingPointType ftrR, vtkFloatingPointType ftrA, vtkFloatingPointType ftrS, 
00303     vtkFloatingPointType fbrR, vtkFloatingPointType fbrA, vtkFloatingPointType fbrS, 
00304     vtkFloatingPointType lcR,  vtkFloatingPointType lcA,  vtkFloatingPointType lcS, 
00305     vtkFloatingPointType ltlR, vtkFloatingPointType ltlA, vtkFloatingPointType ltlS,
00306     vtkFloatingPointType zoffset) {
00307     vtkFloatingPointType fc[3], ftl[3], ftr[3], fbr[3], lc[3], ltl[3];
00308     fc[0]=fcR; fc[1]=fcA; fc[2]=fcS;
00309     ftl[0]=ftlR; ftl[1]=ftlA; ftl[2]=ftlS;
00310     ftr[0]=ftrR; ftr[1]=ftrA; ftr[2]=ftrS;
00311     fbr[0]=fbrR; fbr[1]=fbrA; fbr[2]=fbrS;
00312     lc[0]=lcR; lc[1]=lcA; lc[2]=lcS;
00313     ltl[0]=ltlR; ltl[1]=ltlA; ltl[2]=ltlS;
00314     return(this->ComputeRasToIjkFromCorners(fc, ftl, ftr, fbr, lc, ltl, zoffset));};

00316   // Description:
00317   // The matrix that transforms a point in RAS space to IJK space. 
00318   // The 4x4 matrix is listed as a string of 16 numbers in row-major order.
00319   vtkSetStringMacro(RasToIjkMatrix);
00320   vtkGetStringMacro(RasToIjkMatrix);
00321 
00322   // Description:
00323   // Same as the rasToIjkMatrix except the y-axis is directed up instead 
00324   // of down, as is the convention in VTK
00325   vtkSetStringMacro(RasToVtkMatrix);
00326   vtkGetStringMacro(RasToVtkMatrix);
00327 
00328   // Description:
00329   // A ScaledIJK-to-RAS matrix formed by accounting for the position and 
00330   // orientation of the volume, but not the voxel size
00331   vtkSetStringMacro(PositionMatrix);
00332   vtkGetStringMacro(PositionMatrix);
00333 
00334 
00335   // Description:
00336   // This function solves the 4x4 matrix equation
00337   // A*B=C for the unknown matrix A, given matrices B and C.
00338   // While this is equivalent to A=C*Inverse(B), this function uses
00339   // faster and more accurate methods (LU factorization) than finding a 
00340   // matrix inverse and multiplying.  Returns 0 on failure.
00341   static int SolveABeqCforA(vtkMatrix4x4 * A,  vtkMatrix4x4 * B,
00342                 vtkMatrix4x4 * C);
00343   static int SolveABeqCforB(vtkMatrix4x4 * A,  vtkMatrix4x4 * B,
00344                 vtkMatrix4x4 * C);
00345
